repo_notes.content:
OVERLAY AGI project started 02-05/May/2025.

The Overlay Artificial General Intelligence (Overlay AGI) project represents a comprehensive, practical approach to developing artificial intelligence systems that combine neural processing with symbolic reasoning and external knowledge management. Unlike traditional AI research focused primarily on theoretical frameworks or mathematical models, this project emphasizes building complete, working systems that can be deployed in real-world applications while maintaining scientific rigor and cognitive plausibility.

This system is specifically designed to address fundamental limitations found in current artificial intelligence approaches - particularly the over-reliance on massive parameter training, opaque decision-making processes, and lack of efficient knowledge organization. The project's goal is to create AI systems that can reason effectively, maintain transparency, operate efficiently across diverse contexts, and evolve continuously through human feedback while remaining grounded in biological principles of cognition.

pages.title: FolderStructure
pages.purpose: Describes the complete folder structure of the project, explaining how different folders relate to each other and what content they typically contain. Serves as a global overview of the organizational architecture.

pages.title: ProblemClarification
pages.purpose: Describes the fundamental problems in artificial intelligence development that the project specifically addresses, detailing current industry shortcomings and model limitations, and explaining the need for the overlay architecture.

pages.title: ProjectHistory
pages.purpose: Contains files describing the historical progression of project development, including personal reflections, development milestones, retrospective insights, and evolutionary thoughts about how ideas have developed over time.

pages.title: Project_Review
pages.purpose: Contains brief summaries or reviews of the overall project status, providing quick snapshots of current achievements, challenges, development phases, or strategic decisions made during the project lifecycle.

pages.title: Token_Litography
pages.purpose: Covers files discussing token-level processing and specialized word selection methods, explaining how the system handles individual tokens as fundamental building blocks for reasoning.

pages.title: LLM_Selector
pages.purpose: Covers all aspects of the LLM selector architecture, describing how a small language model chooses from specific candidate sets using semantic weights and external knowledge tables instead of full neural generation.

pages.title: Software
pages.purpose: Covers software packages, tools, or infrastructure used in development, including CUDA frameworks, LangFlow components, Python libraries, Docker configurations, and API integrations.

pages.title: Hardware
pages.purpose: Encompasses files discussing hardware requirements for building the AI system, covering server selection criteria, component specifications, and performance considerations for the overlay architecture design.

pages.title: Neurobrain_CogScience
pages.purpose: Contains research related to neuroscience, brain function, and cognitive processes, explaining how human thinking patterns and neural dynamics relate to the architectural decisions in the system.

pages.title: CodingAgent
pages.purpose: Covers files related to programming agents or AI assistants that help with code development, detailing how the system generates code solutions using overlay principles combined with semantic knowledge structures.

pages.title: Sport_Bio_Agent
pages.purpose: Describes biological and sports-related agent systems, exploring how the overlay approach extends to physical activities, biological processes, or sports performance analysis.

pages.title: OverlaySemanticWeight
pages.purpose: Crucial for files describing semantic weight management techniques outside of LLMs, explaining how the system stores and uses semantic weights as external knowledge tables that guide decision-making.

pages.title: IT_specialists
pages.purpose: Deals with information technology specialists and team composition, detailing recruitment requirements and specific competencies needed to support the overlay architecture.

pages.title: Other
pages.purpose: A catch-all category for files that don't neatly fit into any other category or where primary classification confidence is below 80%.

pages.title: RAW_Ideas_Chat
pages.purpose: Handles raw ideas that emerged from chat conversations, representing spontaneous thoughts or insights collected during interactions with AI systems.

pages.title: RAW_Ideas_Notes
pages.purpose: Covers files containing raw ideas captured as simple notes instead of structured documents, often informal observations or brief conceptual sketches needing further processing.

pages.title: AI_Research_mainstream
pages.purpose: Documents mainstream AI research approaches, established methods, and standard practices, contrasting them with the overlay approach.

pages.title: SimilarProjects
pages.purpose: Contains files describing projects similar to yours that were studied or referenced, providing comparison analysis of other approaches to AI architecture.

pages.title: Physics
pages.purpose: Handles discussions about physical world principles, physics concepts, and applications of AI in studying material reality using overlay architecture concepts.

pages.title: Human_Output
pages.purpose: Covers files discussing how humans produce speech or communication input into the system, describing preferred formats and processing inputs from human thought patterns.

pages.title: AGI_Input
pages.purpose: Details methods for how the AI systems receive input data, including voice recognition processes, graphical user interfaces, and conversion of human requests into actionable information.

pages.title: Input_Enchance
pages.purpose: Covers the crucial 20-30 step process of enhancing human desires, explaining how detailed input is captured through multiple phases of analysis to better understand user intent.

pages.title: Input_Context_Expand
pages.purpose: Describes methods for expanding the context of user requests by generating specification details or lists of tasks that are not explicitly mentioned in the initial input.

pages.title: Input_Convert_to_InnerThink
pages.purpose: Explains conversion processes that transform user requests and specifications into internal dialogue structures within the AI's thinking process, maintaining natural thought flow.

pages.title: Metod_Of_Think
pages.purpose: Collects various methods for thinking approaches that can be applied in the system, describing different reasoning patterns, cognitive frameworks, or analytical techniques.

pages.title: PoV_Router
pages.purpose: Covers files describing Point of View routing mechanisms, explaining how the system implements expert switching and model selection based on current context within the overlay framework.

pages.title: Overlay_NeuralNet_N2S
pages.purpose: Covers ideas specifically related to the neuro-neuro-symbolic (NÂ²S) architecture, detailing how neural components are combined with symbolic structures and overlay layers.
